article.headline: BYU 90, Boise State 77
article.story: PROVO, Utah (AP) -- Mike Hall scored 21 points and pulled down nine rebounds to lead Brigham Young to its highest scoring total of the season in a 90-77 win over Boise State on Wednesday night. The Cougars (2-5) were 28-for-57 from the floor and made nine of 12 attempts in the closing minutes to seal the much-needed victory. BYU also made 11 of 21 3-pointers, getting six from Mike Rose, who finished with 19 points. Trailing by eight at halftime, Boise State (4-3) jumped back into the game with an 13-5 run to tie it up before Rose built back the lead. McNeal Thompson led the Broncos with 22 points and five three-pointers. Hall, who finished with five assists, also shut down Jermaine Blackburn, who has been leading the Broncos in scoring, holding him to 4-of-14 shooting for nine points. Five BYU players scored in double figures as the Cougar bench outscored the starters 48-42. Austin Ainge scored 14, Jared Jensen scored 13 and Keena Young finished with 11 points for the Cougars.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
